name: Suspicious Outbound Kerberos Connection
description: Detects suspicious outbound network activity via kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.
query: (winlog.channel:Security AND (event.code:5156 AND destination.port:88) AND (NOT (process.executable:(/.*\\[Ll][Ss][Aa][Ss][Ss]\.[Ee][Xx][Ee]/ OR /.*\\[Oo][Pp][Ee][Rr][Aa]\.[Ee][Xx][Ee]/ OR /.*\\[Cc][Hh][Rr][Oo][Mm][Ee]\.[Ee][Xx][Ee]/ OR /.*\\[Ff][Ii][Rr][Ee][Ff][Oo][Xx]\.[Ee][Xx][Ee]/))))
note: **Detection Rule without Regex for better understanding. Be careful, this way is case sensitive:**`(winlog.channel:Security AND (event.code:5156 AND destination.port:88) AND (NOT (process.executable:(*\\lsass.exe OR *\\opera.exe OR *\\chrome.exe OR *\\firefox.exe))))`
